text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Karlovy Vary Region | other_name = Carlsbad Region | native_name = Karlovarský kraj | native_name_lang = cs | settlement_type = Region | image_skyline = Eger-Karlsbad-1.jpg | image_flag = Flag of Karlovy Vary Region.svg | flag_size = | image_shield = Karlovy Vary Region CoA CZ.svg | shield_size = | image_map = Karlovarský kraj in Czech Republic.svg | mapsize = | map_alt = | map_caption = | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Czech Republic | seat_type = Capital | seat = Karlovy Vary | parts_type = Districts | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = (ANO) | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 3314.46 | elevation_m = | elevation_max_m = 1244 | elevation_min_m = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 294896 | population_as_of = 2019-01-01 | population_density_km2 = auto | iso_code = CZ-41 | registration_plate = K | website = www.kr-karlovarsky.cz }} The Karlovy Vary Region or Carlsbad Region is an administrative unit (kraj) of the Czech Republic. The capital city is Karlovy Vary. The region is world-famous for its spas, including Karlovy Vary and Mariánské Lázně. The Karlovy Vary Region is divided into 3 districts: ==References== Category:2001 establishments in Europe Category:Bohemia
